header_summary:
Moonsettler's input highlights the importance of viewing a specific table not as a definitive reflection of consensus within the Bitcoin Development Mailing List but as a starting point for further dialogue, aiming to foster a more nuanced conversation about consensus dynamics within the community. This perspective stresses the need for continuous engagement and thoughtful evaluations among members to navigate the evolving consensus landscape effectively. [More about Moonsettler's perspective](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/6Jm_AoIIskhEfyAwJFVFmzzA1iJJ3h51yCC8TwgO_MhV-ARzL9s7fVynKdN0-rNqNrN3kYsklxTZDGuko8LMsT0SW-Idy7tdA_u_e0s_Zsk=@protonmail.com/T/#mb82be7810027f64d8ab0ec6a59ba3d8c7c4b91ec).

Ian Quantum et al. discuss the challenges and progress in the transition towards quantum-safe cryptography, including the failure of FALCON's NIST vetting and the formalization of other cryptographic standards. This conversation underscores the urgency of migrating Bitcoin's code to quantum-resistant protocols in light of rapid advancements in quantum computing technology, which threatens current cryptographic standards. [NIST's announcement on cryptographic standards](https://csrc.nist.gov/News/2024/postquantum-cryptography-fips-approved) and [Alice and Bob's research on quantum computing](https://alice-bob.com/blog/computing-256-bit-elliptic-curve-logarithm-in-9-hours-with-126133-cat-qubits/) provide critical context to this discussion.

The developer's proposal to enhance Bitcoin's resilience against control and censorship through the innovative use of the "nLockTime" feature in transactions is a technical exploration aimed at leveraging existing Bitcoin protocol functionalities. This approach seeks to balance transaction efficiency with fairness, by giving older transactions a better chance of being included in a block, thus proposing a nuanced update to the transaction selection process for the Bitcoin mempool. [Explore the technical proposal](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/f1a0153b-3142-4e01-a68e-92c458762b89@dashjr.org/T/#m79b93d3c8f40715707d41cd1b4a2e8158496005e).

1440000bytes and cguida delve into the complex dynamics of Bitcoin's development ecosystem, discussing the nature of Bitcoin-related products and the challenges in update submission and script expressiveness. These discussions reflect on the innovation and operational challenges within the Bitcoin community, from the lifecycle of Bitcoin-related products to the strategic considerations in enhancing Bitcoin's scripting capabilities without introducing vulnerabilities. [Read about operational codes and Bitcoin's infrastructure](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/transitory-soft-forks-for-consensus-cleanup-forks/1333/11) and [expressive scripting capabilities versus security](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/ctv-op-templatehash-and-op-inputamounts/1344/11).

- Moonsettler views the table as a discussion starter, not a consensus indicator.

recent_posts.title: Trivial QC signatures with clean upgrade path
recent_posts.summary:
- FALCON failed NIST vetting repeatedly since 2022, but progress shown in other standards by 2024.
- A new algorithm can break ECC-256 in 9 hours, highlighting rapid quantum computing advancements.
- The cryptographic community faces a readiness challenge against quantum threats, necessitating vigilance.

recent_posts.title: Mandatory Inclusion of Old Transactions in Blocks
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal discusses enhancing Bitcoin's resilience against control by using "nLockTime".
- It suggests a dual sorting method in the mempool for transaction fees and "nLockTime".
- This approach aims for fairer transaction inclusion by balancing fee rates and timestamp priority.

recent_posts.title: Transitory Soft Forks for Consensus Cleanup Forks
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's evolving landscape sees frequent product launches and discontinuations due to user interest.
- Opcodes like OP_CLTV, crucial for Bitcoin operations, differ from conventional products in development and purpose.
- Recognizing opcodes as foundational elements, not products, better reflects their role in Bitcoin's infrastructure.

recent_posts.title: Contract-level Relative Timelocks
recent_posts.summary:
- The current update submission method introduces risks and inefficiencies, causing discrepancies.
- The CLRT aims to address issues of outdated submissions, protecting system integrity.
- Delays could notably increase if parties strategically submit known outdated states.

recent_posts.title: CTV++ OP_TEMPLATEHASH and OP_INPUTAMOUNTS
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion highlights concerns over Bitcoin's scripting capabilities compared to Ethereum's.
- It emphasizes the need for caution to prevent complexities and vulnerabilities.
- A balance between innovation and Bitcoin's integrity is deemed essential for its development.

active_posts.title: Trivial QC signatures with clean upgrade path

- Quantum computing may challenge Bitcoin's encryption, suggesting a switch to hash-based signatures.
- Taproot enhancements could offer quantum resistance without immediate changes from users or developers.

active_posts.title: Summary: Covenants Support - Bitcoin Wiki
active_posts.summary:
- Significant updates to the Bitcoin covenants wiki were made in November 2024.
- Feedback led to a dedicated page for Bitcoin use cases and moderation enhancements.
- Discussions continue on opcode applicability and the need for technical consensus in Bitcoin development.

active_posts.title: Mandatory Inclusion of Old Transactions in Blocks
active_posts.summary:
- This proposal mandates Bitcoin miners to include 0.1% oldest transactions in each block.
- It aims to combat mining centralization and ensure democratic transaction processing.
- Non-compliant blocks will be rejected, promoting fairness and decentralization in Bitcoin.

active_posts.title: CTV, APO, CAT activity on signet
active_posts.summary:
- BIP 118 enables more flexible Bitcoin transactions by allowing signing without specifying previous outputs.
- BIP 119's use reflects its aim for complex conditions and secure vaults through `OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY`.
- Despite less detail, `OP_CAT` under BIP 347 sees most use, enhancing Bitcoin script functionalities significantly.

active_posts.title: Timewarp attack 600 second grace period
active_posts.summary:
- Matt Corallo proposed a Bitcoin soft fork to limit `nTime` rolling for mining efficiency.
- The proposal includes enhancing template renewal frequency to reduce excessive timestamp adjustments.
- Discussions advocate expanding `nTime` adjustment grace periods to two hours to maintain network security.

active_posts.title: Fastest-possible PoW via Simple DAG
active_posts.summary:
- Braidpool's new difficulty algorithm achieves consensus without traditional metrics, optimizing DAG width.
- The algorithm adjusts difficulty by analyzing the average number of block parents, aiming for two.
- Comparing with Avalanche, both systems balance efficiency, security, and decentralization in blockchain consensus.

today_in_history_posts.title: Bi-directional micropayment channels with CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Nathan Cook proposed a reversible micropayment channel using CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY for bidirectional payments.
- This protocol employs P2SH addresses and a hashlock mechanism for secure transaction reversals.
- It aims to improve upon current one-directional payment limitations, allowing flexible, secure exchanges without predicting payment counts.

today_in_history_posts.title: Routing and explicit trust
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The paper discusses risks in "channel counterparty" and "Clearinghouse" terms.
- It questions how trustless routing through intermediaries and selection occurs.
- Systematic risks and interconnected counterparty failures are highlighted issues.

today_in_history_posts.title: V3 transaction policy for anti-pinning
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Gloria Zhao proposed a new "V3" policy to solve Bitcoin pinning issues.
- The V3 policy discussion follows the mailing list's impending discontinuation.
- A pull request in Bitcoin Core shows steps toward implementing V3's designs.
